item.title: Untramen Vocal Synth Wave 2 Charms Up for Preorder!
item.dc:creator: Momoi
item.description:
Digital artist Untramen Taro has unveiled her latest product. Her massive Vocal Synth Charm Set is up for pre-order! Preorders for my Vocal Synth (Wave 2) Charms are up! Preorders will end January 18th.https://t.co/5015vqK4TTCan't get them now? Don't worry! There will be a Wave 3 in the future.Want the designs in sticker form? Check out …

The post Untramen Vocal Synth Wave 2 Charms Up for Preorder! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
Digital artist Untramen Taro has unveiled her latest product. Her massive Vocal Synth Charm Set is up for pre-order!

As of now, there are over 100 characters to choose from!

Every version of each vocal synth was created. Retired and canceled characters were also included.

She even added characters beyond VOCALOID! Synthesizer V, CeVIO, UTAU, Sharpkey and Alter/Ego vocal characters are available, too.

The charms are available in different sets. The cheapest option sits at a single charm for $8 USD.

Options range from a 3-charm set at $22 USD, up to a $700 USD set for all the charms!

Pre-orders are up until January 18, 2020. You can pre-order on the official product page, here!

Now, which characters are you most excited to see? Furthermore, which charm set do you want to buy? Tell us in the comments!

Sources

Untramen Taro is on Twitter, RedBubble, Etsy and her official website.
Pre-order page for Vocal Synth Charms (Wave 2) is here!

The post Untramen Vocal Synth Wave 2 Charms Up for Preorder! appeared first on VNN.

item.title: AHS 2020 Calendar Launches!
item.dc:creator: Momoi
item.description:
AH-Software Co., Ltd has released their 2020 calendar! The product features VOCALOID and VOICEROID characters. Each month sees a new beloved character for you to enjoy! AHSå“ä¸Šã‚«ãƒ¬ãƒ³ãƒ€ãƒ¼ã€2020å¹´ç‰ˆã¯ã“ã‚“ãªæ„Ÿã˜ã§ã™ï¼ https://t.co/CynDOGAbBe pic.twitter.com/JwykS7BtR4— AHSå…¬å¼ (@ahsoft) January 1, 2020 AHS revealed teaser images and bonuses for buying the product in late 2019. Now that it’s out, let’s get a look …

The post AHS 2020 Calendar Launches! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
AH-Software Co., Ltd has released their 2020 calendar! The product features VOCALOID and VOICEROID characters. Each month sees a new beloved character for you to enjoy!

AHS revealed teaser images and bonuses for buying the product in late 2019. Now that it’s out, let’s get a look at what they have in store.

Purchase of the calendar is here, on its product page!

The AHS calendar is priced at 1,500 JPY; 1,650 JPY after tax (~$15 USD). The calendar features all characters in their updated designs from VOCALOID4 through VOICEROID2! Additionally, the company revealed the illustrations for each month.

Following the initial release of the calendar, AHS added that there will be bonus gifts given on a first come, first serve basis.

As of now, customers who purchase the calendar can receive a “card-sized” calendar featuring Nekomura Iroha.

Not only that, but they will also get an “AHS Original” postcard! This postcard features Haruno Sora, Tsurumaki Maki and Kaai Yuki!

The calendars also feature unique details and events. For example, every character’s birthday is marked! Now you can keep track of your favorite AHS girl or boy and celebrate.

Furthermore, each calendar has two different sides. One side features a full illustration, and the other shows the calendar. This way you can choose between displaying art or following the days.

Be sure to grab your calendar as soon as possible so you don’t miss out on your bonuses! Which character are you excited to see featured? Let us know in the comments!

Sources

The official product page is here!

AH Software is on Twitter, YouTube, Facebook and their official website.

The post AHS 2020 Calendar Launches! appeared first on VNN.

item.title: AHS 10th Anniversary Fan Contest Begins!
item.dc:creator: Momoi
item.description:
Fans of AHS VOCALOIDs, rejoice! In honor of the company’s 10th anniversary, a contest has been announced by EHAMIC to celebrate the event! AH Software Co., Ltd is the company responsible for the VOCALOIDs such as sf-a2 miki, Kaai Yuki and Hiyama Kiyoteru. These character vocals are AHS’ first foray into singing software from back …

The post AHS 10th Anniversary Fan Contest Begins! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
Fans of AHS VOCALOIDs, rejoice! In honor of the company’s 10th anniversary, a contest has been announced by EHAMIC to celebrate the event!

AH Software Co., Ltd is the company responsible for the VOCALOIDs such as sf-a2 miki, Kaai Yuki and Hiyama Kiyoteru. These character vocals are AHS’ first foray into singing software from back in 2009.

Since then, several more vocals have since been released, such as Nekomura Iroha, Yuzuki Yukari, Tohoku Zunko, Macne Nana, Kizuna Akari and Haruno Sora.

Deespite a healthy library of VOCALOID and VOICEROID voicebanks alike, AH Soft has been tragically lacking in recognition and appreciation despite their 10 year tenure.

Luckily, one longtime fan and producer is looking to change that.

EHAMIC, writer of over 70 songs and well-respected contributor to the VOCALOID community, has taken it upon himself to put together this contest!

According to the producer, the event is being held to mark the 10th anniversary with some much needed appreciation for AHS.

He laments that there aren’t very many events going on in 2019, especially in the realm of Yukari and friends’ company. So in order to reconcile this, he’s decided to put the project together, himself!

Song Contest Requirements

In order to enter the song contest, entrants need to make sure they can meet all of the following requirements.

  • The song must use an AHS VOCALOID. Voicebanks from other companies, even if used as backing vocals or otherwise, will not be permitted.
  • Contestants must be available to reach via SNS (Twitter, email, etc.)
  • Themes that revolve around celebrations and anniversaries in general, or specifically for AHS’ 10th anniversary.
  • Contestants must be current creators of songs (having been on hiatus or retired will not allow entry), regardless of skill! Professionals and hobbyists are all welcome in this competition.

The song contest will end on two dates. The earliest submissions are accepted is September 10th. This is available if you need your song to be mixed down by someone else.

With this method, you can send in the .wav file raw, and it will be mixed by a participant in the judging panel.

Otherwise, the deadline is September 20th if you send in your song fully mixed.

Album Cover Art Contest

The contest for the album art has a good number of similarities to the song conest, but just a few notable differences to keep in mind!

  • The album art must feature an AHS VOCALOID; there is no limit whether you wish to feature one, all, or a number in between of the characters AHS has provided.
  • Artists must also be readily available via SNS (Twitter, email, etc.)
  • Themes must revolve around a celebration or anniversaries, most specifically the AHS 10th anniversary
  • Contestants for the art contest must also be current artists (no hiatus or retired artists who no longer upload). Professionals, hobbyists and anyone in between are also welcome!

Art Specifications

  • Drawings must be 12 cm x 12 cm in size (standard square CD jacket)
  • 400 DPI resolution minimum in order to print clearly
  • Minor adjustments to the cover, such as the addition of text, will be added later if necessary

The deadline for the art contest is September 10th, and there won’t be an extension! Get to work quickly if you wish to contribute!

Contest Prizes

EHAMIC hasn’t decided how many prizes will be given out to either participants or just to the winners, but he has told us what exactly the prizes will be despite who gets them.

  • The finished, physical CD
  • Other compensation is being considered, but has not been decided yet.

This article will be updated with more information as it comes out! Please be patient while we wait with EHAMIC to decide what all will come of this contest.

He does note that because it is being produced by the fan community and not the company itself, it is not clear how much will go into the financials of putting this album together, let alone the prizes for the contest.

He does suggest that further prizes beyond the CD itself are in the works, however, so stay tuned! There’s no telling what could come of this love letter to AHS.

Extra Details

EHAMIC explains in the extended contest post that he intends to have the CD put together and published by October 20th.

His wish is to have the physical CD brought to AH Software’s studio, as a gift to thank them for all their hard work!

He wants any fans who can go to Tokyo to bring a copy of the CD to present to AHS staff with him, so that more AHS employees can have this album as a gift.

The presentation to the staff will be roughly around November 17th. However, it’s possible the date will shift later on. We’ll keep you posted on future updates!

The CD will be available to purchase and will be given out to winners and participants as well, so don’t worry!

The contest will be ending nearly a month from now, so if you wish to get your shot in, now’s the time!

Good luck!

Sources

EHAMIC can be found on Twitter, NND, YouTube and his website.
AHS is also on Twitter!

The post AHS 10th Anniversary Fan Contest Begins! appeared first on VNN.

Megpoid‘s 10th anniversaryÂ was on June 26th of 2019. The well known Vocaloid music label, VOCALOTRACKS, released an announcement that they will be holding a song contest for Megpoid’s 10th anniversary. The post A VOCALOTRACKS Song Contest for Megpoid’s 10th anniversary is Here! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
Megpoid‘s 10th anniversaryÂ was on June 26th of 2019. The well known Vocaloid music label, VOCALOTRACKS, released an announcement that they will be holding a song contest for Megpoid’s 10th anniversary.

Contest details

VOCALOID Megpoidç™ºå£²10å‘¨å¹´ã‚’è¨˜å¿µã—ã¦ #GUMI ãŒæ­Œã†ã‚ªãƒªã‚¸ãƒŠãƒ«æ¥½æ›²ã‚’å‹Ÿé›†ä¸–ç•Œã¸å‘ã‘ã¦å…¨æ›²é…ä¿¡æ‰‹ç¶šãã‚’å®Ÿæ–½ã€‚ï¼ˆè¦å®šæœ‰ï¼‰7/29ï¼ˆæœˆï¼‰15æ™‚ã¾ã§ã€‚VOCALOID4 Megpoid æœ€å¤§40%OFFã‚­ãƒ£ãƒ³ãƒšãƒ¼ãƒ³ã‚‚å®Ÿæ–½ä¸­ã€€https://t.co/CXZMEZNTMB #vocaloid#vocalotracks#GUMIç”Ÿèª•ç¥­2019#GUMIèª•ç”Ÿç¥­2019 pic.twitter.com/LeAEo3VWhd

— VOCALOTRACKS (@VOCALOTRACKS) June 27, 2019

VOCALOTRACKS has given many details and specifics about this contest. The requirements for voicebanks are simple, all Megpoid banks are viable. The application dateline isÂ June 26th through July 29th. The songs can either be new and unpublished or not, any genre is welcome. However, if the song is attached to another label and under specific copyright that it may not be able to used elsewhere, is not allowed.

Songs that are on CD’s are allowed, but only if the rights are available. If there are multiple credits to a song, only one person of that song can upload it. Music using anything that isn’t Megpoid is not allowed, even in harmonies or backing vocals.

Song requirements

In this announcement, the page has listed guidelines for what each song should follow. People who enter will need to register an account, giving their name, email and phone number. This rule is only for first time contest entries for VOCALOTRACKS.

The announcement also gives very detailed information about specifics of the song and file that the song will be on. The file must be in .wav format, in 16 bit and up to 44.1 kHz. The song file must be up to 65 megabytes and up to 6 minutes long. The lyrics must also be available in a .txt file. The thumbnail image must be up to 2500 x 2500 pixels, within an aspect ratio of 1:1. It is also the same with the full photo, but it can be varied depending on the site posted.

There must be credits of every person that worked on the song, especially of the copyright holder.

Every person has a limit of 2 songs.

Distribution sites

Pick up songs from the contest will be availableÂ  though the following websites in Japan :

  • iTunes
  • Amazon
  • AWA
  • Google
  • KKBOX
  • Line music
  • Mora
  • Spotify
  • Youtube
  • Rekochok
  • others (unlisted)

While overseas will find them through those websites instead:

  • iTunes(International)
  • Amazon
  • eMusic T-Mobile World Wide
  • Google music
  • KKBOX
  • Spotify
  • etc…

Extra notes

The announcement also details extra notes, just for clarification.

Any information regarding anything of the song cannot be changed after the deadline. If you are under 20 years old, you must have parental consent before entering. You must apply for consent, and written consent is allowed. Finally, you need to be able to say if your entry or entries infringe on any copyright.

That is all that the article says, follow VOCALOTRACKS on twitter for more updates about this contest! It is certain many great composers from Japan and all over the world will make amazing entries, be waiting!

With this, all of the Internet Co. Ltd vocaloids are now 40% sale off! Check it out if you are interested!

ã€æœ€å¤§40%OFFã€‘#VOCALOID Megpoidç™ºå£²10å‘¨å¹´ã‚’è¨˜å¿µã—ã¦å½“ç¤¾VOCALOIDãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒªã‚’ç‰¹åˆ¥ä¾¡æ ¼ã§ã”æä¾›ãƒœãƒ¼ã‚«ãƒ­ã‚¤ãƒ‰ãƒŸãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒƒã‚¯é…ä¿¡å°‚ç”¨ãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒ™ãƒ«ã€ŒVOCALOTRACKSã€ã§ã¯ã€#Megpoid ãŒæ­Œã†æ¥½æ›²ã‚’å‹Ÿé›†ä¸­ä»Šã‹ã‚‰ãŠæ±‚ã‚ã®ä¸Šã”å¿œå‹Ÿã„ãŸã ãã“ã¨ã‚‚å¯èƒ½https://t.co/btNNq8giPC#GUMI#GUMIèª•ç”Ÿç¥­2019 pic.twitter.com/87Sh8MHIg3

— shopsswjp (@shopsswjp) June 27, 2019

You can find GUMI onÂ FacebookÂ andÂ Twitter
Same goes for Internet Co. Ltd, which also has english-speaking social medias! Find them on Facebook (Japanese/English) or Twitter (Japanese/English).
Contest page

The post A VOCALOTRACKS Song Contest for Megpoid’s 10th anniversary is Here! appeared first on VNN.

item.title: Buy MAIKA and Get Bruno & Clara for Free!
item.dc:creator: Hoshi
item.description:
December 18th marks VOCALOID MAIKA‘s anniversary! To celebrate her third birthday, Voctro LabsÂ is holding a special anniversary sale until December 22nd! The Sale Until December 22nd, fans can purchase the boxed version of MAIKA for â‚¬99 (about $104 USD) and receive the boxed version of BrunoÂ &Â Clara for free! Bruno and Clara’s boxed version costs â‚¬109 …

The post Buy MAIKA and Get Bruno & Clara for Free! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
December 18th marks VOCALOID MAIKA‘s anniversary! To celebrate her third birthday, Voctro LabsÂ is holding a special anniversary sale until December 22nd!

The Sale

Until December 22nd, fans can purchase the boxed version of MAIKA for â‚¬99 (about $104 USD) and receive the boxed version of BrunoÂ &Â Clara for free! Bruno and Clara’s boxed version costs â‚¬109 (about $114 USD).

This sale applies ONLY to the boxed versions of the softwares. You can’t purchase MAIKA’s download version and receive downloads of Bruno & Clara.

In addition, these purchases don’t come with the VOCALOID Editor. In order to use these VOCALOIDs fully, you’ll have to purchase either the VOCALOID 3 or VOCALOID 4 Editor separately. They do, however, come with the Tiny VOCALOID Editor to get you started.

About the VOCALOIDs

Bruno, Clara, and MAIKA are all Spanish VOCALOIDs made by Voctro Labs. MAIKA, however, has phonemes that make her able to sing in a variety of languages. Official demos show her singing in Catalan, Italian, English, and Japanese. This makes her voice bank incredibly versatile.

Bruno and Clara don’t have the extra phonemes but still offer incredible voices. And with the deal of getting them both for free, it’s hard to pass up! The Spanish VOCALOID trio is definitely not one to miss and now’s a great time for lovers of the boxed versions to grab all three for an insanely low price!

How to Purchase

You can purchase MAIKA’s boxed and digital versions on Voctro’s website here. You can also check out Bruno and Clara here. The product pages also provide demos of their respective VOCALOIDs, so be sure to check them out!

You can also skim the VocaDB pages of the three for even more songs.

MAIKA
Bruno
Clara

Please note that VocaDB is not affiliated with Voctro Labs and is simply a database created by the community. Unless specifically marked as an official demo, the song isn’t officially recognized by Voctro Labs.

You can also follow MAIKA on Facebook here.

The post Buy MAIKA and Get Bruno & Clara for Free! appeared first on VNN.

item.title: More Fanloid Potential Added with VOCALOID 4 Software Update
item.dc:creator: Hoshi
item.description:
We previously covered AHS’s announcement that almost all of the V3 and V4 VOCALOIDs would be able to cross synthesize with each other. Now we have more information on this tool as well as another company joining in! As of the VOCALOID 4 Editor / VOCALOID 4 Editor for Cubase Ver.4.3.0 update, AHS and Internet …

The post More Fanloid Potential Added with VOCALOID 4 Software Update appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
We previously covered AHS’s announcement that almost all of the V3 and V4 VOCALOIDs would be able to cross synthesize with each other. Now we have more information on this tool as well as another company joining in! As of the VOCALOID 4 Editor / VOCALOID 4 Editor for Cubase Ver.4.3.0 update, AHS and Internet Co. VOCALOIDs will be able to cross synthesize with other VOCALOIDs. This leads toÂ even more potential for fans to create interesting new voices and increases the ways fans can create a fanloid of their own.

How it Works

Before this update, only V4 and some V3 VOCALOID voice banks could cross synthesize (XSY) with each other and they were restricted to the voice banks in their library. Yukari’s V4 voice banks could all XSY with each other, but she couldn’t cross synth with Tohoku Zunko or Yukari V3, for example. This new update allows different voice banks to XSY with completely different voice banks, creating a wide range of different voices for fans to try.

Restrictions

At the moment, only AHS and Internet Co. VOCALOIDs are capable of this function and they can only XSY with other VOCALOIDs from the same company. So, for example, GUMI V4 Natural can’t cross synthesize with Yukari Onn.

There are also a few voice banks from these companies that aren’t able to XSY with other voice banks at all. From AHS, Kaai YukiÂ is excluded and Internet Co. has excluded GUMI English.

Included VOCALOIDs


For a full list of the AHS VOCALOIDs included, please see our previous article.

The Internet Co. VOCALOIDs capable of the new function are as follows:

All V4 GUMI voice banks

Megpoid Native
Megpoid Power
Megpoid Whisper
Megpoid Adult
Megpoid Sweet

éŸ³è¡—ã‚¦ãƒŠ V4 Sugar
éŸ³è¡—ã‚¦ãƒŠ V4 Spicy

Gackpoid V4 Native
Gackpoid V4 Power
Gackpoid V4 Whisper

Gackpoid Native
Gackpoid Power
Gackpoid Whisper

kokone

Chika

Lily Native
Lily V3

GACHAPOID V3

More VOCALOIDs in the future?

At the moment, there’s no word on if more companies will opt into this in the future. The popularity of the feature will likely play a huge role in the advancement of this expansion, however. So if you’re interested, be sure to check it out!

Fans who want to use the feature should update to the 4.3.0 version of the VOCALOID 4 Editor.

As always, stay tuned to VNN for updates! If any more VOCALOIDs are added to this new feature, we’ll be sure to let everyone know.

Sources: Internet Co. Website, Official VOCALOID Website

The post More Fanloid Potential Added with VOCALOID 4 Software Update appeared first on VNN.

item.title: Create Your Own Fanloids with AHS VOCALOIDs!
item.dc:creator: Hoshi
item.description:
While many VOCALOID voice banks are only able to cross synthesize with themselves, AHS recently announced quite the game changer. All AHS V3 and V4 voices minusÂ Kaai Yuki will soon be capable of cross synthesizing with each other! This will allow you to create your own fanloids with AHS VOCALOIDs! VOCALOIDs Capable of Cross Synthesis …

The post Create Your Own Fanloids with AHS VOCALOIDs! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
While many VOCALOID voice banks are only able to cross synthesize with themselves, AHS recently announced quite the game changer. All AHS V3 and V4 voices minusÂ Kaai Yuki will soon be capable of cross synthesizing with each other! This will allow you to create your own fanloids with AHS VOCALOIDs!

VOCALOIDs Capable of Cross Synthesis

The VOCALOIDs that will be capable of cross synthesizing with each other are:

Tohoku Zunko V4 Natural
Tohoku Zunko V3
Yuzuki Yukari V4 Jun
Yuzuki Yukari V4 Onn
Yuzuki Yukari V4 Lin
Yuzuki Yukari V3
Nekomura Iroha V4 Natural
Nekomura Iroha V4 Soft
Hiyama Kiyoteru V4 Natural
Hiyama Kiyoteru V4 Rock
SF-A2 Miki V4 Natural
Macne Nana V4
Macne Nana V4 Petit

Update: Macne Nana V3‘s Japanese bankÂ will also be able to cross synthesize with other AHS voice banks.

 

Of course, you’ll have to own these VOCALOIDs to use their voice banks. You can buy digital downloads of Kiyoteru Natural and Rock, Iroha Natural and Soft, and miki Natural at the onlineÂ VOCALOID store. You can also purchase copies of AHS VOCALOIDs from AHS’s online store. Plus, Kiyoteru’s V4 starter pack is still available on CD JapanÂ if you’d like a physical version! To top it off, the starter pack also comes with the VOCALOID 4 Editor, letting anyone without it start right away!

In addition, AHS gave an example of this new cross synthesis during their latest live stream. Start around the 1:18:00 mark to get a listen!

We’ll all be looking forward to the new addition to cross synthesis capabilities. AHS is actually encouraging fans to use this to create their own fanloids as well! And with so many voices to choose from, the possibilities are endless.

So stay tuned for more information on this as it surfaces! We’ll be sure to let fans know when AHS releases any updates.

The post Create Your Own Fanloids with AHS VOCALOIDs! appeared first on VNN.

item.title: IA Sings “Kimi Wa Hitori Nankaja Naiyo” Acapella for Charity
item.dc:creator: Hoshi
item.description:
While IA has covered songs sung by her voice actress before (the most famous being "Tori no Uta"), her acapella cover of "Kimi Wa Hitori Nankaja Naiyo" ("You're Not Alone") takes things a step further and even gives fans a new way to listen to 1st Place's VOCALOID. And as an added bonus, all purchases

The post IA Sings “Kimi Wa Hitori Nankaja Naiyo” Acapella for Charity appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
While IA has covered songs sung by her voice actress before (the most famous being “Tori no Uta”), her acapella cover of “Kimi Wa Hitori Nankaja Naiyo” (“You’re Not Alone”) takes things a step further and even gives fans a new way to listen to 1st Place’s VOCALOID. And as an added bonus, all purchases of the song go to charity!

Press Release

IA’s acapella cover of “Kimi Wa Hitori Nankaja Naiyo” is available for digital distribution… RIGHT NOW!

It was July 7th, 2011, when Lia released a single album for the victims of the tsunami and recorded an intense version of “Kimi Wa Hitori Nankaja Naiyo” (“You’re Not Alone”) in one take on piano. That attempt became “Song of Life”, an album made of tracks inspired by the themes of “hope” and “life” in honor of the victims of the 3/11 tsunami and earthquake.

On the other hand, IA’s cover of “Kimi Wa Hitori Nankaja Naiyo” is produced in a totally different style, an acapella performance thatÂ you can’t miss!

Last but not least!
The revenue of the sales of Lia’s original version and IA’s cover of “Kimi Wa Hitori Nankaja Naiyo” will be donated to the foundation Michinoku Mirai (å…¬ç›Šè²¡å›£æ³•äºº ã¿ã¡ã®ãæœªæ¥åŸºé‡‘), which helps the young victims of the tsunami to continue their studies.

Good music x Good action!

Hoshi’s Review

It’s not often that we get to listen to an actual VOCALOID song where the VOCALOID is the only instrument used. But “Kimi Wa Hitori Nankaja Naiyo” proves that doing so can lead to absolutely amazing results. IA provides the main and backing vocals perfectly, and despite not being human, manages to bring a good amount of human emotion to the song. One can hear the changes in her voice and, much like Lia’s version, hers manages to pull a hugely emotional response from me as well. And this is featuring nothing but IA’s vocals.

The song is just as beautiful as Lia’s version if not more so as the focus on IA’s voice brings incredible attention to what she’s singing. I can listen to it over and over again and continue hearing new things that I missed the first time. It’s truly a work of art and I would recommend this to any VOCALOID fan. It’s a technical masterpiece as well as an artistic one.

If you’d like to listen for yourself before buying, 1st Place does allow you to listen to the first minute and a half of the song on iTunes.

Where to Buy

Purchase on iTunes.

Currently, the song is only available on iTunes with the price varying depending on the location. You can also purchase Lia’s version on iTunes here if you’re interested. Remember that all proceeds for both songs do go to Michinoku Mirai. So not only do you get great music but also you get to help a great cause as well!

The post IA Sings “Kimi Wa Hitori Nankaja Naiyo” Acapella for Charity appeared first on VNN.

The post Zyon X Exit Tunes Collaboration appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
The VOCALOID mobile rhythm game Zyon has teamed up with EXIT TUNESÂ in order to bring Mayu to the game, as well as many of the VOCALOID songs from Exit Tunes. Some of these songs include “Meltdown” by Kagamine Rin and “Nyan Cat”. Also, several well-known producers will be featured in the game such as LamazePÂ and iroha.

You can find more information on Zyon here. Also, you can find all updates on their Facebook page. The Android version of the game is on its way as well, so stay tuned!
https://www.facebook.com/aquatraxzyon/

The post Zyon X Exit Tunes Collaboration appeared first on VNN.
